definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: bear fruit, be fruitful (NH = BH 1, [[פְּרִי]] = BH; Ph. [[פר]] fruit; Eth. farya: faraya: blossom, bear fruit; As. pir'u, posterity; cf. also Targum [[פֵּירָא]] Syr. pe0ro0 fruit, and Ba:ZMG xii (1887), 604):—

of men and animals, Ex 23:30 (E) Ge 26:22 (J); esp. + [[רבה]] Je 3:16, Je 23:3, Ez Eze 36:11, Ge 35:11, Ge 47:27 (P), and [[שָׁרַץ]] (P) Ge 8:17, Ge 9:7, Ex 1:7, ´[[פְּרוּ וּרְבוּ וּמִלְאוּ וגו]] Ge 1:22, Ge 1:28, Ge 9:1.

of vine, [[גֶּפֶן פּׂרִיׇּה]] Is 32:12 fruitful vine, so Ps 128:3 (sim. of wife); cf. (in fig. of Isr.) Ez Eze 19:10; in Mess. prediction Is 11:1 a shoot from his [Jesse's] roots shall bear fruit; c. acc. [[ראׁשׁ]] ´[[שׁׂרֶשׁ פ]] fig., De 29:17 a root bearing gall (as its fruit); [[יִפְרוּ יֶשַׁע]] Is 45:8 is dub., read perh. 3 fs. [[תֵּפֶר]] let earth be fruitful in salvation (Oort al.); Pt. f., as subst., [[הַפּׂרַיׇּה]] the fruit-bearer, poet. for tree, Is 17:6 (cf. [[[סָעִיף]]]
); so [[בֵּן פּׂרָת]] Ge 49:22, Ge 49:22 Joseph is son of a fruit-bearer, i.e. a fruitful bough.
make fruitful, subj. ´[[י]] c. acc. of man or people:
shew fruitfullness, bear fruit (Ges:§ 53 c. d, g): Impf. 3 ms. [[יַפְרִיא]] Ho 13:15 (as if from [[פרא]]).
